page.title: 03OLD SOUTHWELL
page.content: {Southwell}might have had a connection with the{Romans}because there were rumours that there is a town under{Southwell}called{'Ad {Pontem.' Roman coins}have been found on{Southwell Burgage}and in other places around{Southwell. The{Burgage}belongs to{The Burgage {Manor. The Burgage Manor}is a large white Georgian Mansion. {Southwell}is mentioned in{The {Domesday Book}as{Sudwell}and through the years it has changed to{Southwell. When the{Domesday Book}was made The Normans who originally came from France, ruled England. South in French is sud, so this could have a connection with why Southwell is called Southwell now.
